title: VLAs and G1 (in progress)
description: Developing a simulation-to-reality pipeline for the Unitree G1 humanoid to perform autonomous laboratory manipulation tasks. The system utilizes NVIDIA's GR00T N1.5 foundation model within Isaac Lab, integrating upper-body vision-language-action control with lower-body stabilization policies.

title: VLAs and SO-101 (in progress)
description: A diagnostic testbed utilizing the SO-ARM101 robotic arm to validate data collection workflows and teleoperation strategies for VLA training. Uses custom ROS2 bridge scripts to stream leader-arm inputs directly into Isaac Sim, facilitating the isolation of data quality variables and testing GR00T's performance on simpler embodiments before scaling to the G1.

title: Transformers for Control
description: Can transformer models, using only in-context learning, reliably perform low-level closed-loop control and stabilization of unstable nonlinear dynamical systems such as cartpole and acrobot?
